Overview  Package   Class 
CFMongoDB API
FRAMES  

cfmongodb.components
Class -

cfmongodb.components.IDocument

public class -

All MongoDB Documents should implement this interface. Basic ColdFusion structures can also be saved to the datastore. But from an OO design perspective, it's a good practice to implement this interface

Method Summary
 string save()
          Commits this Document instance to the datastore and returns an ID
 any setCollection()
          Sets the collection to which this Document instance belongs. This should be called prior to any other operations. If not, the default Collection, if any, will be the container for this Document.
 any update([any field], [any value])
          Performs in-place updating - Instead of retrieving and updating every item within a document, this method is more efficient, allowing for 'Cherry Picking' of specific data elements to update.
 

Method Detail

save

public string save()
Commits this Document instance to the datastore and returns an ID

setCollection

public any setCollection()
Sets the collection to which this Document instance belongs. This should be called prior to any other operations. If not, the default Collection, if any, will be the container for this Document.

update

public any update([any field], [any value])
Performs in-place updating - Instead of retrieving and updating every item within a document, this method is more efficient, allowing for 'Cherry Picking' of specific data elements to update.

Parameters:
field
value
